column4: <Ropechoborra> - it shouldn't be.  I'm running it on a 700 MhZ Duron, watching a DVD and writing code in Gedit.  No speed demon, but it works.
<Ropechoborra> - check $top to see if there is anything that is running that is eating processes that shouldn't be,
i got 2 tasks running and 100 sleeping.. is that usual ?
sounds about right.  Look for an entry in the top that says  "xx.xx % idle"
<Ropechoborra> - look at the "top" output - and tell me what % idle is.
<Ropechoborra> - 82.7 % user - means that something is using 89 % of the processor . . . is that constant?
no... it goes from 30 to that...
no to much... but is something usual, for eg. when i open a common window or switch desktops it is a bit slow

<Ropechoborra> - Keep an eye on the system monitor and just see if there is something that looks like it's running out of control....all I can suggest off the top of my head.  Nothing seems out of the ordinary.
- I haven't run across anything better
i got some processes that dont know what are they for.. , for eg: the mapping-deamon
